item.title: The Flooze add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Those are brave men," he told Ser Balon in admiration. "Let's go kill them." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "There's some heinous fuckery goin' on mon." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Sleep is good," he said. "And books are better." He gave her a quick kiss on the cheek." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Don't be ridiculous, Charlie, people love the parents who beat their kids in department stores. It's the ones who just let their kids wreak havoc that everybody hates." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Blessed are the dumbfucks." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "I can be most colorful and inventive when I am angry." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Not unlike the toaster, I control darkness." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Charlie Asher: Mrs. Ling, is that duck wearing trousers? Mrs. Ling: Could be . . . . You hear of paper-wrap chicken? This duck in pants." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "What to do if you find yourself stuck in a crack in the ground underneath a giant boulder you can't move, with no hope of rescue. Consider how lucky you are that life has been good to you so far. Alternatively, if life hasn't been good to you so far, which given your current circumstances seems more likely, consider how lucky you are that it won't be troubling you much longer." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Ford... you're turning into a penguin. Stop it." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It is known that there are an infinite number of worlds, simply because there is an infinite amount of space for them to be in. However, not every one of them is inhabited. Therefore, there must be a finite number of inhabited worlds. Any finite number divided by infinity is as near to nothing as makes no odds, so the average population of all the planets in the Universe can be said to be zero. From this it follows that the population of the whole Universe is also zero, and that any people you may meet from time to time are merely the products of a deranged imagination." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "But the plans were on display…” “On display? I eventually had to go down to the cellar to find them.” “That’s the display department.” “With a flashlight.” “Ah, well, the lights had probably gone.” “So had the stairs.” “But look, you found the notice, didn’t you?” “Yes,” said Arthur, “yes I did. It was on display in the bottom of a locked filing cabinet stuck in a disused lavatory with a sign on the door saying ‘Beware of the Leopard." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Ford!" he said, "there's an infinite number of monkeys outside who want to talk to us about this script for [book:Hamlet|1420] they've worked out." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Sorry," [Hamlet] said, rubbing his temples. "I don't know what came over me. All of a sudden I had this overwhelming desire to talk for a very long time without actually doing anything." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "After all, reading is arguably a far more creative and imaginative process than writing; when the reader creates emotion in their head, or the colors of the sky during the setting sun, or the smell of a warm summer's breeze on their face, they should reserve as much praise for themselves as they do for the writer - perhaps more." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Don't ever call me mad, Mycroft. I'm not mad. I'm just ... well, differently moraled, that's all." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Books may look like nothing more than words on a page, but they are actually an infinitely complex imaginotransference technology that translates odd, inky squiggles into pictures inside your head." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Humpty had always sat on walls, it was his way." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "He was, after all, the ultimate rebel -- it takes a lot of cojones to stand up to Zeus." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "You'll like it here; everyone is <i>quite</i> mad." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description:
"Relax. You're in good hands. Tabby wont hurt you.
She stabbed me!
Damn! I told her not to stab any more Hunters. I hate it when she does that." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "The strongest steel is forged by the fires of hell. (Savitar)" -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: The Flooze add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "The alarm in the morning? Well, I have an old tape of Carlo Maria Giulini conducting the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra in a perfectly transcendent version in Shubert's seventh symphony. And I've rigged it up so that at exactly 7:30 every morning it falls from the ceiling onto my face." -- Stephen Fry
